page.title: 15The Way of Life in Bramdean
page.content: 53%of the adult population go outside the home to work, of these approximately half commute outside the village. 32%of the adult population are housewives or students, a few of whom work part time. 15% of the adult population are retired, and 18% of the total population are children. The village church remains a centre of interest as well as worship; many of the village events are organised by parishioners. Households of 2 or less tend to use the village shop for all general food purchases. Larger households tend to go outside the area for these requirements and only use the village stores for occasional purchases. The services of the post office are used by all villagers. The village pub is well patronised by local people; it also has a good passing trade.
